title: CROWler Ruleset Schema
description: The CROWler ruleset schema defines the structure of a ruleset file, which contains rules for scraping, action execution, detection, and crawling.

format_version.title: The Ruleset Format Version
format_version.description: Version of the ruleset format, to ensure compatibility.

author.title: Author's name
author.description: The name of the author or owner of the ruleset.

created_at.title: Creation Date
created_at.description: The date of when this version of the RUleset was created. SUpports multiple date-time formats.

description.title: Ruleset function description
description.description: A brief description of what the ruleset does.

ruleset_name.title: Ruleset Name
ruleset_name.description: A unique name identifying the ruleset.

rule_groups.title: Rules Groups
rule_groups.description: A list of rule groups, each containing mixes of scraping, action, detection, or crawling rules.

group_name.title: Group's Name
group_name.description: A unique name identifying the group of rules.

valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: The start date from which the rule group becomes active.

valid_to.title: Valid Till
valid_to.description: The end date until which the rule group remains active.

is_enabled.title: Is Enabled
is_enabled.description: Flag to enable or disable the rule group.

url.title: URL
url.description: Optional. The specific URL to which this rule group applies. Can be a regex pattern.

scraping_rules.title: Scraping Rules
scraping_rules.description: A list of rules to extract data from web pages.

rule_name.title: Rule's Name
rule_name.description: A unique name identifying the scraping rule.

pre_conditions.title: Pre-Conditions
pre_conditions.description: Conditions that must be met for the rule to be considered for execution.

path.description: The specific path or pattern to match for scraping.

url.description: Optional. The specific URL to which this rule applies. If omitted, the rule is considered applicable to any URL matching the path.

wait_conditions.title: Wait Conditions
wait_conditions.description: Conditions to wait before being able to execute the rule and scrape the data. This to ensure page readiness. Do not use this field to wait after 'navigate_to_url' action type, it doesn't do that, instead it will wait to execute 'navigate_to_url'.

value.description: a generic value to use with the condition, e.g., a delay in seconds, applicable for delay condition type. For delay type you can also use the CROWler exprterpreter to generate delay values at runtime, e.g., 'random(1, 3)' or 'random(random(1,3), random(5,8))'. If you're using plugin_call, then value field is ignored.

selector.description: The CSS selector for the element, applicable for element_presence and element_visible conditions. This field is used for the plugin's name when the condition_type is 'plugin_call'.

elements.title: Page's Elements
elements.description: Defines multiple ways to find and interact with elements, allowing for CSS, XPath, and other strategies.

selectors.title: Selectors
selectors.description: Defines multiple ways to find and interact with elements, allowing for CSS, XPath, and other strategies. This field is ignored when using action_type like navigate_to_url, forward, back, refresh, close_window, accept_alert, dismiss_alert, get_alert_text, send_keys_to_alert, and take_screenshot.

selector_type.description: The type of selector to use to find the element. To extract data using plugins, set this field to 'plugin_call'.

selector.description: The actual selector or pattern used to find the element based on the selector_type. This field is used for the plugin's name when the selector_type is 'plugin_call'.

selector_attributes.description: Optional. Attributes specific to each selector type. Check the documentation for the specific selector type to see which attributes are supported.

name.description: The name of the attribute to extract, e.g., 'class'.

value.description: Optional. The attribute's value of the element to extract, e.g., 'class_name'.

attribute.description: Optional. The attribute of the element to extract. This field is ignored when using CROWler plugins via plugin_call.

value.description: Optional. The value within the selector that we need to match for the action. (this is NOT the value to input!)

extract.title: Extract Data
extract.description: Optional. The type of data to extract from the element, e.g., 'text', 'html', 'attribute'.

pattern.description: The name of the attribute to extract, applicable for 'attribute' type.

extract_all_occurrences.description: Flag to extract all occurrences of the element, not just the first one. This flag has no effect when using CROWler plugins via plugin_call.

critical.description: Flag to indicate if the element is critical for the rule to be considered successful. Keep in mind that setting this flag will make the rule fail and set the Source crawling to error state. This can be useful to stop the crawling process if a critical element is not found and get it re-scheduled with a different Proxy IP if the problem was due to a block.

transform_html_to_json.description: Flag to indicate if the extracted data should be transformed into JSON format. This is useful for structured data extraction when you specified html in the extract -> type -> html.

extract_scripts.title: Extract Page's Scripts
extract_scripts.description: Indicates whether the rule also has to extract scripts from a page and store them as separate web objects. This is useful for analyzing JavaScript code using 3rd party tools and vulnerability analysis.

objects.title: Objects
objects.description: Identifies specific technologies, requires correspondent detection rules.

rule_name.description: A unique name identifying the detection rule.

json_field_rename.title: JSON Fields Renaming
json_field_rename.description: Given that the CROWler scraper maps automatically HTML tags to JSON tags, you can use this feature to rename the json-html tag with whatever name you wish to use.

source_tag.description: The JSON tag you want to rename.

dest_tag.description: The new name for the JSON tag.

post_processing.title: Rule's Post-processing

step_type.description: The type of post-processing step to perform on the scraped data. To use plugins to process the data, set this field to 'plugin_call' and place the plugin name in the 'details' object using a field called 'plugin_name'. Do not use 'transform' if you want to use a plugin to transform the output, use 'plugin_call' instead.

details.description: Detailed configuration for the post-processing step, structure depends on the step_type.

post_processing.description: Rule's Post-processing steps for the scraped data to transform, validate, or clean it. This post_processing section runs within a single rule context. To use external APIs to process the data, use the 'transform' step type and, inside the 'details' object, specify the API endpoint and the required parameters. For example, in details, use { 'transform_type': 'api', 'api_url': 'https://api.example.com', 'timeout': 60, 'token': 'your-api-token' }.

action_rules.title: Action Rules
action_rules.description: A list of rules to interact with web pages.

rule_name.title: Rule Name
rule_name.description: A unique name identifying the action rule.

url.description: Optional. The specific URL to which this action applies or the URL to navigate to, applicable for navigate action. Do not use this field for 'navigate_to_url' action type, use instead the value field to specify the url to go to, url field is only to match the rule.

value.description: a generic value to use with the condition, e.g., a delay in seconds, applicable for delay condition type. For delay type you can also use the CROWler exprterpreter to generate delay values at runtime, e.g., 'random(1, 3)' or 'random(random(1,3), random(5,8))'.

selector.description: The CSS selector for the element, applicable for element_presence and element_visible conditions. If you're using plugin_call, then this field is used for the plugin name.

wait_conditions.description: Conditions to wait for, that must be met before the action is executed. These conditions are designed to ensure that the page or elements are ready (e.g., waiting for an element to appear, or a delay). Do not use this field to wait after an action is performed, as it only applies before the action is executed.

selector.description: The CSS selector to check if a given element exists, applicable for 'element'. The language id to check if a page is in a certain language, applicable for 'language'. The plugin's name if you're using plugin_call.

conditions.description: Conditions that must be met for the action to be executed. For example, you can check if a certain element exists on the page before performing an action. See this as something to do after we waited for the wait_conditions and we verify that the page is ready to perform the action.

action_type.description: The type of action to perform, including advanced interactions and calls to plugins.If you want to use plugins then set this field to 'custom', set selector_type field to 'plugin_call', and place the plugin name in the selector field.

selector_type.description: The type of selector to use to find the element.

selector.description: The actual selector or pattern used to find the element based on the selector_type. This field is used for the plugin's name when the selector_type is 'plugin_call'.

name.description: The name of the attribute to match for the selector match to be valid.

value.description: The value to of the attribute to match for the selector to be valid.

attribute.description: Optional. The attribute of the element to match

value.description: The value within the selector that we need to match for the action. (this is NOT the value to input!)

selectors.description: Defines multiple ways to find and interact with elements, allowing for CSS, XPath, and other strategies. This field is ignored when using action_type like navigate_to_url, forward, back, refresh, close_window, accept_alert, dismiss_alert, get_alert_text, send_keys_to_alert, and take_screenshot.

value.description: The value to use with the action, e.g., text to input, applicable for input_text.

ignore.description: Flag to ignore errors and continue with the next action.

retry_count.description: The number of times to retry the action on failure.

retry_delay.description: The delay between retries in seconds.

error_handling.description: Error handling strategies for the action.

step_type.description: The type of post-processing step to perform after an action rule has been successfully executed. At the moment the only valid post_processing step is 'collect_cookies'.

detection_rules.title: Detection Rules
detection_rules.description: A list of rules to detect technologies and objects on web pages.

rule_name.title: Rule Name
rule_name.description: A unique name identifying the detection rule.

object_name.title: Object Name
object_name.description: The name of the object or technology to identify. This will also be the JSON key in the output. This is also the field to use for the 'implies' field if you want to imply other objects.

key.description: The name of the HTTP header field.

value.description: The expected value of the HTTP header field. You can use Perl-Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) to write your signatures and patterns.

confidence.description: Optional. The confidence level for the match, ranging from 0 to 10.

http_header_fields.description: Matching patterns for HTTP header fields to identify technology.

key.description: The name of the tag to find in the page content.

attribute.description: Optional. The attribute of the tag to match, e.g., 'src' for img tag etc. (leave empty if you want to match the tag's innerText only).

value.description: The pattern to match within the tag's attribute content. You can use Perl-Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) to write your signatures and patterns.

text.description: Optional. The text to match in the tag's innerText. You can use Perl-Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) to write your signatures and patterns.

confidence.description: Optional. The confidence level for the detection, decimal number ranging from 0 to 10 (or whatever set in the detection_configuration).

items.description: Phrases or character sequences within page content indicative of specific technology.

page_content_patterns.description: Patterns within the page content that match specific technologies.

key.description: The name of the field in an SSL/TLS certificate to find.

value.description: The pattern to match within the field's value. You can use Perl-Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) to write your signatures and patterns.

confidence.description: Optional. The confidence level for the detection, decimal number ranging from 0 to 10 (or whatever set in the detection_configuration).

certificates_patterns.description: Phrases or character sequences within certain certificate's fields indicative of specific technology.

value.description: The micro-signature to match in the URL. You can use Perl-Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) to write your signatures and patterns.

confidence.description: Optional. The confidence level for the match, decimal number ranging from 0 to 10 (or whatever set in the detection_configuration).

items.description: Micro-signatures in URLs that indicate a specific technology, like '/wp-admin' for WordPress.

url_micro_signatures.description: URL patterns indicative of specific technologies.

name.description: The name attribute of the meta tag.

content.description: The content attribute of the meta tag, which holds the value to match. You can use Perl-Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) to write your signatures and patterns.

meta_tags.description: Matching patterns for meta tags to identify technology.

implies.title: Implies
implies.description: Optional. A list of rule's names that this rule implies, e.g., if this rule matches, it implies that the rules in this list also match.

plugin_calls.title: Plugin Calls
plugin_calls.description: Optional. Call a plugin to detect the technology.

plugin_name.description: The name of the plugin to call.

plugin_parameters.title: Plugin's Parameters
plugin_parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the plugin.

parameter_name.description: The name of the parameter to pass to the plugin.

parameter_value.description: The value of the parameter to pass to the plugin.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: The name of the supported external detection provider.

crawling_rules.title: Crawling Rules
crawling_rules.description: A list of rules to crawl web pages and fuzz parameters.

rule_name.description: A unique name identifying the crawling rule.

request_type.description: The type of request to perform for fuzzing.

selector.description: The actual selector or form name used to find and interact with the target elements for fuzzing.

target_elements.description: Specifies the elements to target for fuzzing, including forms.

parameter_name.description: Name of the parameter to fuzz.

fuzzing_type.description: The fuzzing strategy to use for the parameter.

values.description: List of values to use for fuzzing, applicable if 'fuzzing_type' is 'fixed_list'.

pattern.description: A pattern to generate fuzzing values, applicable if 'fuzzing_type' is 'pattern_based'.

fuzzing_parameters.description: Defines the parameters to fuzz and the strategy for generating fuzz values.

environment_settings.title: Environment Settings
environment_settings.description: Optional. Custom key value settings to use in the rules. Normally used to set environment variables for the rules.

key.title: Setting's Name
key.description: The name of the environment setting. It has to be unique within the Rulesgroup namespace.

value.title: Setting's Value
value.description: A single or a set of values for the environment key.

properties.title: Setting's Properties
properties.description: Optional. Additional properties for the environment setting. These properties are used to define the behavior of the environment setting.

persistent.description: Optional. Flag to indicate if the environment setting should be persistent after ruleset completes execution.

static.description: Optional. Flag to indicate if the environment setting should be static and not changeable. That means that the value will be set once and never changed.

source.description: Optional. The source of the environment setting. If not set manually then the current URL will be used as the source.

log_level.description: Optional. Specifies the logging level for actions and scraping activities.

log_message.description: Optional. The message you want to log if the rule matches something.

logging_configuration.description: rule log configuration (aka what you want to be logged when the rule execute).

post_processing.title: Rulesgroup's Post-processing

step_type.description: The type of post-processing step to perform on the scraped data. To use plugins to process the data, set this field to 'plugin_call' and place the plugin name in the 'details' object using a field called 'plugin_name'. Do not use 'transform' if you want to use a plugin to transform the output, use 'plugin_call' instead.

details.description: Detailed configuration for the post-processing step, structure depends on the step_type.

post_processing.description: Rulesgroup's Post-processing steps for the scraped data to transform, validate, or clean it. This post_processing section runs within the context of the entire rulesgroup (so it will access the entire JSON of collected data). To use external APIs to process the data, use the 'transform' step type and, inside the 'details' object, specify the API endpoint and the required parameters. For example, in details, use { 'transform_type': 'api', 'api_url': 'https://api.example.com', 'timeout': 60, 'token': 'your-api-token' }.
